div.a: The Scientists Who Fly Into Hurricanes

div.div: On August 17, 2010, Terry Lathem flew through a hurricane to pick up some bacteria. He had a huge smile on his face. A month later, he was at it again.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YcxusO&via=Digg&text=The Scientists Who Fly Into Hurricanes

div.a: China's Giant Transport Plane Takes Off

div.div: The successful maiden flight of the Y-20, China’s first domestically developed heavy air freighter, marks a step in the country’s goal of building a strategic air power, according to military experts and observers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WmSkpT&via=Digg&text=China's Giant Transport Plane Takes Off

div.a: 'House Of Doom' Sees Nine Die In 15 Years

div.div: A building in the leafy suburbs of Berlin has been dubbed the house of doom after it emerged that nine people died unnatural deaths there in the last 15 years.

div.a: The Inside Story Of India’s Most Controversial Trial

div.div: The game of cricket, a passion for money, dreams, earthquakes and religious riots: Aarushi Talwar, 13, was lost in the world of the novel The 3 Mistakes of My Life. It was the night of May 15, 2008. The next morning, this only child of two dentists was found dead on her bed in the New Delhi suburb of Noida, her body covered with her white flannel blanket.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10Yks6S&via=Digg&text=The Inside Story Of India’s Most Controversial Trial

div.a: How Iraq Became A Proxy War For Exxon And BP

div.div: For more than a year, ExxonMobil has stood as the backbone of Kurdistan politics, validating its independence as a global petro-player. Now, BP has taken up the mantle for the opposing side, shoring up Baghdad in a tense standoff at the city of Kirkuk.

div.a: Where Are The Bicycles In Post-Apocalyptic Fiction?

div.div: In the vast majority of these novels there is no mention of any means of human transportation between a car and walking. So some guy has to walk home hundreds or thousands of miles across a post-apocalyptic landscape to get back to his family. What's with that?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14okTXM&via=Digg&text=Where Are The Bicycles In Post-Apocalyptic Fiction?
